title: Digit Sum
text:
For a pair of integers a and b, the digit sum of the interval [a, b] is defined as the sum of all digits occurring in all numbers between (and including) a and b. For example, the digit sum of [28, 31] can be calculated as:2+8  +  2+9  +  3+0  +  3+1 = 28Given the numbers a and b, calculate the digit sum of [a, b].InputOn the first line one positive number: the number of test cases, at most 100.After that per test case:one line with two space-separated integers, a and b (0 ≤ a ≤ b ≤ 1015).OutputPer test case:one line with an integer: the digit sum of [a, b];ExampleInput:3
0 10
28 31
1234 56789Output:46
28
1128600
